lines.text: Montana in the '80s - the cattleman was king, his herds grazed a hundred thousand square miles of pasture. There was so much room that fertile range land was going to waste - but not for long. Shepherds and their sheep sought the lush green pasture of the north.
You liver-lipped brush pile! You double-crosser! You killer in sheep's clothing!
Polecats, sheepmen, and other varmints keepout
